facts.fact: Gerrymandering is the act of drawing the political map for my...I mean your benefit!
Gerrymandering is named after Gov Elbridge Gerry, and a pecuilar district he approved.
Districts are drawn by their states giving both sides the chance to gerrymander.
Some states are too small to be gerrymandered, as they only have 1 district.
Only 4 states, CA, ID, AR, WA have non-partisan boards that draws the map.
'Packing' - Squishing as many voters into a single district to make them lose elsewhere.
'Cracking' - Breaking up voters into as many districts as possible to weaken them.
